Add Producer interface.Notes: This is my equivalent of ReactiveX's Observable. It uses a subscribe() method.

Add option to turn off CSV error squiggl.Notes: This can actually really improve performance.

Fix bug where pressing enter in an eleme.Notes: I decided to not do any special newline/whitespace auto-adding because in VS Code the best way to do that is to use a TextMate grammar, and I do want to do that. Everything else was just becoming hacky.

Add 'Apply Fix' line to error messages.Notes: Can't do this until VS Code supports urls in Diagnostic objects.

Notes.Abandoned reasoning: I don't really have a good idea of what this really means, so I'm not going to do it for now.

Notes.Root cause: Ended up being an issue with quotes inside of the comment. Because I made QuotedString an XML Lex, if a unclosed QuotedString was inside of a Comment (which was a segment), then the QuotedString would take the comment's closing sequence (-->), which would make the comment think it wasn't closed. This happened a lot when apostrophes were in the comment.

Notes.Idea: Allow a map/dictionary data structure that can store and retrieve values based on a range, instead of a single value.

Add syntax highlighting.Notes: Start simple. Maybe base the coloring on the current XML coloring

Notes.Motivation: As I roll out VS Code extensions, I wish that I could test them on my own machines for a couple of days before I roll them out to the world. VS Code has only two models for running your extension: Experimental and Publicly Released. It would be nice if I coudl release my extensions to just my own machines, then maybe to my close friends and contacts, and then once I'm confident that it's working fine, then I could roll it out to the world.
In VS Code the context menu is statically based on the extensions that are installed, but so often I want to change the contents of the context menu based on what I right-click on.

Notes.Idea: Qub Dev is a text editor/development environment that uses plugins/extension to add support for different languages.
A simple app that lets you view and manage the funds on your orca bus pass
